inn1.comm: Ambles through the channel outside off, perfect line and length to start off with, Gilchrist watches it sail past him.
He gets behind this one - similar line and length, pushed to the cover region
Jaffa! What a delivery from Hoffmann! Landed on a length, around off, Gilchrist was sucked into a forward drive but was shocked as the ball left him late. very late.
On the middle and leg, turned to the leg side
around off stump, angling away, ran down to thirdman. Again probling line and length. Good solid start so far.

Appeal for lbw! Hoffmann is on fire. full in length, around middle and off, straightens after landing and Hayden doesn't quite lean onto his defensive prod. Must have got an inside edge. The replays show the ball hit the pad first. hmm
Wide outside off, left alone. Two slips in place.
Fuller and right on the middle stump line, an attempted yorker, Gilchrist gets his bat down in a hurry, the bat-handle rotates in his hands and the ball runs through the midwicket gap
Slightly short of length - Scotland continue to hit the right line and the length, on the off and middle, pushed to cover
short of length, on the off and middle, Hayden gets right behind the line to defend
Blain gets into the Caribbean mood. Bangs this one in short, a bumper, but the line is wrong. Sails down harmlessly down the leg side.
Another good strangling over comes to an end. Fullish, on the middle stump line, bends in a touch, Hayden leans forward, turns it towards mid-on
hones in on the off stump, angling away, Glichrist goes back, opens the bat-face, pushes it to cover point
tip and run. Leans forward to a length-delivery, pushes it towards mid-off and they rush across for a single
There is the first boundary. Bit of rubbish on the legs and Hayden clears the trashcan with a flick shot, past square-leg. Easy.
angling away from Gilchrist who lets that one go through to the 'keeper
Ooh! close. Just flies past the diving point fielder. Full and outside off, Gilchrist goes after that, clears his arms but only gets an outside edge and just about manages to clear point.
Caressed away! Class. Slightly overpitched, outside off and Hayden was quick to lean forward and drive it past the bowler, past mid-off and to the boundary
Back of length, on the off stump line, Hayden decides to work it to the leg side.
Short and bit of width outside offstump, cut to thirdman
overpitched on the off stump but Gilchrist drives straight to mid-off. A golden chance wasted there. Quite unlike Gilchrist.
Gilly is up and away. Slightly short, little bit of room outside off and that' s enough for our master blaster to cut it past point
Full length delivery outside off, slightly shaping away from the left-hander. Hayden lets it go watchfully
Shifts his length this time, back of a length and straighter. Going away from the left-hander just a shade. Hayden adjusts in the last minute and keeps it out
Full ball. Nice easy action from Hoffmann. Full ball on off and Hayden cracks it straight to the short extra cover fielder. Good stop that time
Straighter line, Hayden whips it square on the leg side. Tries to pinch a single but Gilchrist screams a denial
Easy run-up and smooth follow-through. A typical English action with some swing in the air. Hayden lets it go outside off
Wide ball conceded but good swing to encourage the bowler. Starts on middle and leg and swings at a fine arc. Hayden has nothing to do with one way down leg
Left alone outside off. Good probing over that
Oh! No ball called but quite a handful for Gilchrist. Teasing outside off and moving it away off the seam. Gilchrist beaten comprehensively that time
Typical Gilchrist response. Blain pushes it too full and Gilchrist smashes it through the extra cover region. Surely it must have burnt some grass on the way to the fence
Ouch! Too close to the body and Gilchrist gets away with a wild slash. Thick edge flies over first slip for another boundary. Moral victory for Blain - if ever there's anything like a moral victory
Straight and back of a length this time. Gilchrist on the back foot and defends it confidently.
Short ball from Blain. Not that quick though and Gilchrist rocks back and turns it square on the leg side for an easy single
Good seam movement again. Pitched on leg and moving away from the left hander. Hayden gets away with a thickish edge that squirts past gully for a brace
Shade of inswing from Blain. Hayden defends it back to the bowler
Tip and run from Gilchrist. Tapped to cover and Gilchrist steals an easy single. Short cover comes into place for Hayden
Back of a length delivery and luckily it was straight. Hayden, standing outside his crease,  was lining up an almighty swing. Checked his shot in the last minute
Blitzer! Hayden walks down the wicket nonchalantly and dismisses the ball over the long-on fence for a cracking six. Hayden at his bullying best there.
Quite a bit of swing into the batsman. No room for Hayden, as he tries to repeat the stroke. Cramped for room and brings his bat down in the last moment. Appeal for lbw but that was going down leg
Defended off the back foot
Too wide from Hoffmann. The first real rank delivery and Hayden punishes it with a slash through covers. Ball races away to the point fence
Wide and slightly back of a length. Gilchrist goes for the fierce slash but can't time it. Straight to the cover fielder
Straight and accurate from Blain. Gilchrist gives it the respect it deserves and defends it back to the bowler
Short ball from Blain and Gilchrist is up for the challenge. Pulls with a mighty swing and a thick top edge files over short fine-leg for a one-bounce four.
Full and on the pads, drilled easily to midwicket for a couple
Blain back to probing outside off. That's something he has been doing really well. Gilchrist shoulders arms and has nothing to do with it
Similar delivery and straighter. Patted back down the ground. Australia not doing anything reckless here, just going after the loose deliveries and that seems to be enough
Full, straight on the middle stump line, Hayden leans forward, places it to left of mid-on
back of length, on the middle stump line, Gilchrist stays at his crease, just turns it to mid-on
Full in length, just outside off, Giclhrist eases forward, taps it gently to the off side. The wicketkeeper is standing up to the stumps.
Again angling away, full in length, Gilchrist drives it towards mid-off and sets off for an easy single.
Again on a good length, around that off stump, Hayden just leans forward without thrusting his foot out, pushes it out to short cover
pushes it across Hayden who shoulders arms.
Full and outside off, left alone. The wicketkeeper Smith is standing up
Short and Gilchrist immediately pushes back to pull it to deep midwicket
gentle seam-up stuff, outside off, Hayden opens the bat-face, runs it past point for a easy single.
goes back to a back of length delivery, pushes it out to cover region
sliding away from Gilchrist who shapes to cut but the length is not that short and it runs down towards short thirdman region
on the middle stump line, Gilchrist turns it to left of mid-on who fires in a throw. Rebounds off the batsmen's bat and runs away to the boundary. Four extra runs. Such is life, such is this game.
Fullish, on the middle and leg stump line, deflected to the on side for a single
just short of driveable length, on the off and middle, Hayden thrusts forward and smothers the delivery.
Hayden leans forward, the ball is slightly shorter than he anticipates and he adjusts by opening the bat-face and runs it down to thirdman
On the good length, around off and middle, Gilchrist stays back, turns it towards cover point.
slightly overpitched, driven to mid-off
on the leg and middle, Gilchrist works it past square-leg for a single.
on the hips, Gilchrist pivots to flick it to fineleg region and will come back for two.
full, straight, on the leg and middle, Gilchrist gives his wrists some rest, just turns it to midwicket
Mis-field! Poonia is the culprit. Gilchrist times his offdrive well and Poonia, at long off,  doesn't time his sliding dive well.
honing in on the off stump, pushed to cover region
short of length, gentle pace but Hayden is not going to be sucked into any over-ambitious swipe across the line. He just pushes it to cover point
on the middle and off stump, full in length (they have been pretty good with the length so far), worked to the on side
Again full in length, sliding away and Gilchrist late cuts it to thirdman. Ala Arjuna Ranatunga
Full and on the middle stump line, driven past the bowler but the mid-on comes across to cut it off
slightly overpitched, on the off stump line, driven to mid-off
lands on a length, on the middle, goes on straight, Gilchrist thrusts his right foot across and defends

Almost squeezed between bat and pad. Fullish, on the middle stump line, again Gilchrist's right foot is planted across and he tries to drive it around his pad.  It doesn't work and he gets a inside edge and the ball rolls down the track
Full and straight, no deviation whatsover, on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket
angled away, turned straight to point
back of length, on the off stump, Hayden punches it to right of mid-off for a single.
sliding down to the pads, Gilchrist tries to tickle it away, fails and it runs off the pads to short fine leg
Full, inviting a drive, Gilchrist obliges with a inside-out effort and the cover fielder makes a half-stop
tip and run. Length delivery on the off and middle, Hayden taps it towards mid-off, one look at Gilchrist who responds favourably and off they go
Guess where this was bowled? Yep, full, straight and on that off and middle stump line, turned to point.
Thwack! Hayden had enough of pottering around. Thrust his front foot out and swung through the line.
No change from the bowler, again that sliding/angling/ delivery on the off stump line, driven to cover

Good job from Smith the wicketkeeper. Hayden went for a drive on the up and was beaten. The ball bounced shoulder high (Smith is standing up to the stumps) and Smith gathered it smartly and whipped off the bails but Hayden had dragged his offending feet back into the crease.
works this fullish delivery to cover region for a single
ambling across towards off stump, Gilchrist intercepts with a open-face of the bat and runs it to point
back of length, on the off stump, punched to mid-off.
Short, on the middle, swatted away past square leg.
fuller, on the middle and leg, flicked past square leg.
slightly short, slightly outside off and Hayden goes for a cut. Not great timing though and the ball heads straight to point
touch short in length, on the middle stump line, worked past square-leg for a single.
a gentle seam-up delivery, on the off stump line, driven to right of mid-off
starts off with a full-length delivery, on the off stump line, pushed to point
Swished away! Overpitcched outside off, and Gilchrist crashes it past mid-off. Easy pickings.
corrects his line, gets it on the middle stump line, defended away
73.8 mph delivery on the off stump line, turned to point

Dougie nails Gilchrist. Scotland fielders mob the bowler. Plumb in front. Full and straight on the middle stump line, Gilchrist tries to swing it across the line on a bent knee. No wood on leather and the ball thuds into the pad. Dead duck.
Hayden gets Ponting on strike with a tickle to the midwicket.
short of length, on the off and middle, defended off the back foot
pushed to cover.
on the middle stump line, Ponting lunges forward, as he does, and pushes it to the on side
another lunge, another dot ball. Ponting has the tendency to plant his left foot across and sometimes it gets him into trouble.
slightly short and he cuts it to point
Full, just outside off, Hayden runs it down to thirdman
He is past that 1000-run landmark in WC. Reached there with a dash of class. He leant forward and on drove a full-length delivery past mid-on
beaten! Shapes to cut but not short enough and the ball bounces over the flashing blade
Should have beat Mark Waugh's record there.  Overpitched, well outside off and Ponting drives hard but straight to cover
slides in on the middle and leg, worked to midwicket.
full and outside off, Ponting leans forward and square-drives to point. Bit of fumble but no damage done.
Slap! Bit of room outside off and Hayden leans back to cut it past point.
slightly slower, outside off, Hayden goes down on a bent knee, runs it to backward point
close to the off stump this time and Hayden wants to cut it but is cramped for room. The ball bounds away of an edge to point
on the middle stump line, punched to mid-on
fuller, on the middle stump line, Hayden decides to play it inside-out towards cover. Oohs and aahs from the 'keeper as Hayden played it a touch late. Smith thought it would rap him on the pad.
sliding down on the pads, turned to short fine leg
on the leg and middle, worked past square-leg for a single.
Imperious! Ponting becomes Australia' top-scorer in WC with a fierce pull shot.
Fifty up for Hayden. Ripple of applause goes around. The ball drifted  on to the pads and Hayden sent it down to fine leg
Class. Sheer Class. Slightly overpitched outside off and Ponting eases on the front foot and drives it with the full face of the blade, past mid-off.
again he leans forward, but no full-pitched stuff this time, he turns it to point
floats it on the middle stump line, pushed to the on side
on the off stump line, turns in slightly, pushed to cover and Ponting sets off, Hayden is not interested and Ponting gets back to the crease in a hurry
pushes that one through, on the middle and off, Ponting leans forward to defend
another one that comes in with the arm, on the middle and off, pushed to the off side
slightly short of length, angling away, pushed to mid-off and they rush across for a single
full in length, on the middle and leg stump line, worked to midwicket
gente seam-up stuff on the off stump line, Ponting gets behind the line, turns it to the leg side and the 'keeper Smith goes across to pick it up

Chipped over mid-on! Slower delivery outside off and Ponting tries to swing it over  mid-on, the bat-handle rotates in his hands and the timing goes awry, but he still gets enough wood behind it to send it up and over mid-on
on the middle and leg, short of length, paddled away for a single
Round the wicket from the spinner. Ponting looks to sweep but gets strck on the pads. Half an appeal for lbw. Good ball that time
Quicker ball slipped in outside off. Ponting angles the bat and glides to third man for a fine four
Driven to mid-off for an easy single
Quicker and straighter ball. Hayden down the track and cracks it straight into the ground. Good pick up by the bowler on the follow through
Defended to the on side

Dropped! Wide of off stump from Brown and Ponting goes for the drive to cover. Thin edge goes to the wicketkeeper but Colin Smith can't latch on. Tough chance that but it's not often that Ponting offers a second chance
Clipped to the leg side for an easy single
Drifting down the leg side.
Driven forcefully back to the bowler but no run there. Brown picks it up cleanly
Short ball from Brown and Hayden punishes it savagely for a four through midwicket. Cracked off the front foot and the fielders have no chance. As they would say in these parts, 'Not a man move'
Drifting down leg side and Ponting clips it for an easy single to square leg
Teasing delivery to Ponting. Left-arm spinner Rogers bowling from round the wicket, pitches on off and spins away. Ponting's outstretched bat can't make contact.
Straighter this time and full. Patted back to the bowler
Another good ball, turning away from Ponting and having him in a bit of trouble. Flighted outside off and Ponting can only manage a thickish edge to the covers
Short and Ponting rocks back and cuts it through extra cover for an easy single
Hayden down the track, nullifying the flight and spin. Easing it to midwicket for a single
Ponting uses his feet this time but Rogers does well to hold it back. Driven to covers
Flight and drifting down leg. Hayden clips it away to the leg side for an easy single
Over the wicket this time. Starts from outside off and turns in after pitching. Good grip from the surface here. Ponting gets on the back foot and cuts a short one away for a single
Back to round the wicket. Hayden waits and turns it away
Down the track and taken on the full. Driven to mid-on for a singe

Gotcha! Round the wicket again and the ball pitches on middle and turns away. Hayden tries to drive through the on side but can't account for the spin after the ball grips the surface. Loud appeal and 'slow death' Steve Bucknor raises the finger
Down the track straight away. Ball is drifted outside off and Clarke gets it on the full and drives straight to cover
Rogers slow through the air. Bit of bounce after pitching. Ponting goes back and drives it uppishly to the point fielder
Bit of hesitation after Ponting drives to the off side but a mis-field allows the batsmen to complete a single
Clarke down the track and patted back to the bowler
Quicker through the air this time. Defended watchfully
Quicker again, defended off the back foot. Clarke appears in the mood here
Quicker on off this time. With twinkling feet, Clarke moves away and cuts wide of the gully fielder for a fine four
CRACK! Down the track and Ponting rips a flighted ball from Haq straight over his head for a big six. As easy as Andy there
Defended to the leg side.
Slower and pitching on off. Ponting pushes firmly down the ground
Quicker ball again but too wayward down the leg side. Ponting sweeps it to where it belongs - to the fine leg fence
Tapped for an easy single
lands on the offstump, turns away, Ponting leans forward, waits for the spin, pushes it to point
floated on the middle, driven to long on for a single
on the middle, Clarke goes back, wrists it away towards square-leg
Whoa! Ponting waltzes down the track and sends the ball soaring over long-off. Super strike.
predictably a flatter delivery follows, slightly short as well, Ponting goes back, works it to square-leg
goes on straight with the arm, on the middle, Clarke leans forward, wants to work it past square-leg, doesn't get much power behind that and the ball rolls to the on side
floated on the off stump line, Ponting comes down the track, drives to long on for yet another single
floated well outside off, Clarke comes out, reaches for the delivery, drives it past cover
Fifty up for Ponting. 59th ODI fifty. Came up with a drive to long-off
slightly short, on the off stump line, Clarke backs away, cuts it past point
leans forward, no room or pace to work with and he offers a defensive blade
turns in from middle and off, Ponting turns it past square-leg
Ponting gets off the strike with a drive to long on
comes down the track, the ball dips in front of him, he adjusts, pushes it out through mid-on
drifts on to the pads, Ponting turns it past square-leg and they run hard to come back for two.
low full-toss and Ponting drives it to long on
slightly slower, slightly short, just outside off and Clarke backs away to cut it past point
Nonchalant drive through covers. A low full-toss and Ponting just eases it through the offside ring for a boundary
on the middle and leg, worked past midwicket
Comes down the track, tries to drive but gets it on the pads and they will cross over
full and flat, on the off and middle, driven through the on side
on the middle and leg, picked off the legs, past squareleg for a single
Drifting on to the pads, tickled away fine
slower ball, on the middle stump, driven to long on
overpitched on the legs, Ponting flicks it behind square. Smooth.
pushed to the on side for couple of runs
Gotcha! Haq cleans up Clarke. Flat and fast as the offspinner pushed that one through, slightly short as well  and Clarke goes for a pull but is beaten by the pace. The middle stump is pegged back.
Hodge gets off the mark with a crisp cut.
slower, on the off and middle, Hodge leans forward, turns it to squareleg
Overpitched outside off and Hogg creams it through cover. Ala Damyn Martyn.
sliding on to the pads, tickled away fine
full, straight, on the middle stump, Hodge gets his bat around his front pad, pushes it out towards mid-on
around off stump, full in length, Hodge leans back, late-cuts it to thirdman

appeal for lbw as Ponting is cramped for room while cutting. The ball came in slightly from outside off and Ponting thrust his left foot out and tried to cut. The ball brushed the pad before making contact with the bat but the point of impact was outside off
floated outside off, Ponting drives it through the covers for couple of runs
on the leg side, Ponting paddles it away but can't beat the short fine-leg man
Ponting charges out, Haq sends that one slower through the air and Ponting's heave across the line only gets a thin inside edge and he will get across for a single
turns in from outside off, Hodge is cramped for room as he tries to work it to the off side and is struck on the pad
appeal for lbw as Hodge pushes forward in defense. Impact outside off.
driven to long off for a single
floated on the middle stump line, pushed to the off side. No pace to work around.,
overpitched outside off, driven to long off
That's maximum. Ponting charges out and lofts it straight over the bowler. Up ... up and over.
defense after offense. Leans forward to smother a fullish delivery
full and outside off, drilled to long-off
on the middle stump line, slight turn and defended off the front foot
tossed on the middle and leg, Ponting wrists it away past square-leg and will get two runs.
Bosh! And there he goes again. Another charge down the track. Blink. The ball flies over the long-on boundary.
surprise surprise this is one lot flatter, on the middle stump line, nudged past square-leg
turns in towards off stump, Hodge backs away to cut it past short thirdman
low full toss, on the middle, driven to long-on
lands on the off stump, turns in slightly, Ponting eases forward, punches it towards long-on.
drifts in on the off stump line, driven back to the bowler
comes down the track, the ball is fired on the middle and leg, driven to long on
slightly slower, on the legs, worked past square-leg for a single
Another quick single. A push to extra cover and off they went.
Singles keep coming. The milkmen are at work. On the legs, a tickle to fine-leg
Just outside off, full in length, run down to thirdman
Super shot! Easy on the eye. Just short of driveable length, on the off stump line, Hodge leans forward, punches it through cover.
on the off stump line, pushed out to left of cover for a single.
on the middle, straight, Ponting brings up the 50 of the partnership with a drive to long on
slower one, outside off, Hodge waits, opens the bat-face, runs it down to thirdman for yet another single.
drilled! Overpitched on the off and middle stump line, driven down the ground.
angling in on the legs, driven down to long-on.
similar delivery, same result.
arm-ball, on the off and middle, pushed away defensively to the off side
slightly short, just outside off, Hodge cuts but straight to point.
bit of flight, bit of loop, on the off stump line, Hodge leans forward, drives back to the bowler
on the off and middle, swept away to long leg
slow offcutter, outside off, cut down to thirdman.
drifts away, in the air, outside off, full in length, Ponting reaches out for it, doesn't make contact and the ball bounds of the 'keeper's pad
drags this one short and Hodge pulls it behind square-leg
beaten! slightly slow in pace and outside off, Ponting leans forward, wants to run it down to thirdman and is beaten

almost caught at cover. Ponting reaches out to a full-lenght delivery outside off stump, drives in air and it just falls short of the cover fielder. Ponting moves to 99. On the verge of his fourth WC ton
Slower one ends up as a low full toss outside off and driven straight to cover.
turns in from outside off, Hussey goes back, eases it to cover region
sliding on to the pads and Hussey gets Ponting on strike with a dab past square-leg
Ricky Ponting ... Take a bow! 23rd ODI ton and his fourth WC hundred. Reaches it with a drive to long-on.
now Hussey gets it down to long on
just outside offstump, coming in slightly, turned past point
Sliding down leg side. Bucknor extends his arms to signal a wide.
slightly short in length, on the middle and leg, dabbed past squareleg
again short of length, outside off and Ponting cuts it past cover
Slap-slog! Ponting now has the World record for the maximum sixes in World Cup. 24th six. He went down on his knee and slapped it over deep midwicket
attempted yorker, on the middle and leg, driven to long on
almost at the blockhole, on the middle and off, Ponting can only push it back to the bowler
He is gone!  He attempts another slap-slog, across the line, makes no contact and his offstump is pegged back.
on the off stump line, goes on straight, Watson pushes it to cover region
punched back to the bowler
on the off and middle stump line, pulled to deep midwicket
on the off and middle stump line, pushed to cover point

Colin Smith .... you beauty. Smart work behind the stumps. Full in length and angling away, Hussey makes no contact with his intended drive and his back foot is in the air. Smith gathers and quickly whips off the bails even as Hussey  tries to get his foot down. Too close to call. Referred upstairs and after numerous viewings it has been given out. correctly at that.
On the pads, tapped behind square leg
sliding on the legs, flicked past square-leg
just short of driveable length, on the off and middle stump line, punched on the up back to the bowler
on the off and middle stump line, driven past the bowler
wide outside off stump.
nagging line and length, on the off and middle and short of length, punched back to the bowler. No pace or room to work with for the batsman.
overpitched outside off, powered away to right of sweeper cover. There should have been an easy two but Hogg slipped when he tried to turn for the second.
overpitched on the legs, clipped away behind square-leg
on the middle stump line, Hogg backs away, taps it towards point
again he backs away, but can't get much power behind his drive. The ball rolls to right of cover
Whack! Watson frees his arms. Takes out the front foot outside the line and heaves a length-delivery past midwicket
Boom! Overpitched this time and Watson goes straight over the bowler who ducks under that missile.
Suddenly, its raining fours here. Another one that crashes into deep midwicket region. Slapped across the line.
Yorker, right up there on the middle and off, dug out towards cover point for a single
Wallop! Overpitched outside off and Watson goes over extra cover.
banged in short and outside off, tapped in the air towards thirdman region
Whoa! This one disappears over long on. Overpitched again and Hogg gets under that one nicely.
Hogg goes downtown. Right in the slot and Hogg creams it over long off.
Another whack but the long-on fielder gets across in time to make a smart stop
Violence! Banged in short and Hogg pulls it over midwicket.
smash! Another one, in the slot, just outside off and Hogg drills it over long-off. Murder under cloudy skies
Australia end up with 334. This one slides down the legside and Hogg swings it to fine-leg boundary.  Hogg ends up up with a blistering 15-ball 40!

inn2.comm: Full and angling away, left alone
on the hips, flicked to square-leg
rushes down the channel outside off, has a lame poke but inside the line and the ball heads to Gilchrist
In the zone outside off, just angling away - he is yet to bend it back in, left alone
And again. Two slips in place.
closer to the off stump, pushed out to cover. It will be Shaun Tait who be unleashed on the Scotland batsmen next over.
Majid Haq welcomes Tait with a slash past point. Overpitched and well outside off, Haq frees his arms
Typical. A wide delivery outside off.
141.2 kmph , on the off stump line, Haq gets behind, pushes it out to cover region
slash and a miss. short of length and outside off, Haq wants to cut but is beaten for pace
145.7kmph, full-length delivery whizzng through the channel outside off, Haq doesn't move his feet, just has a lazy waft and is beaten
147k, further away from the off stump, Haq is not able to reach to it.
gets on target, on the stumps, Haq calmly places it towards midwicket and will retain the strike.
on the off and middle stump line, full in length, Haq leans forward to defend
slightly short in length, just outside off, pushed to point
drifting on to the pads, flicked away to fine leg.
Watts is off the mark with a dab to backward point.
Haq looks pretty solid out there. Leans forward to a length-delivery, eases it out into the covers
Angling away from a length, Watts, who looks to have a pretty tight technique, lets it go.
Whistling through the channel outside off, left alone
Just outside off, Short in length and Haq has a flash but misses.
Short of length, outside off, Haq stands up tall to punch it through cover. Looks like a fiesty player
145.8 kmph, sliding away through the channel outside off, Haq is bit late in his intended drive and doesn't get a touch
147.6 kmph, banged in short of length and outside off, Haq sways away from the line
full in length, just outside off, angling away and Watts leans forward, square-drives it towards point where Clarke makes the stop
beaten! teasing delivery outside off and Watts stabs at it
lands on a length, outside off stump, sliding away, Watts eases forward, punches it on the up through cover

dropped by a flying Watson at second slip. Has he dropped the World Cup?! Full and outside off, Watts drives, gets a thick edge and Watto goes parallel to the ground with an outstretched right hand but ends up palming it.
Just short of length, outside off, cut down to thirdman
Whack! Haq creams it through cover. Overpitched outside off and Haq thrusts forward and drives it to the cover boundary. Super strike
Tait cranks up the pace and shortens the length. 150kmph short-pitched stuff, outside off and Haq sways away
cramped for room. Lands short of length, on the middle and leg, straightens and Haq tries to cut but is beaten by the straigthening. It crashes against his thigh pad
Fast and furious. Whistles past the chest of Haq who, again, sways away

Clarke misses a run-out but McGrath does it! Punched to cover and they set off for a run. Clarke fires in a throw at the non-striker's end, the batsman had given up but the ball misses the sticks. They run for overthrows. They turn greedy, they want two of them but Haq can' t beat McGrath's throw. He was looking pretty good in the middle but he has to get back to the hutch now.
Full and straight outside off, Watts drives, gets an outside edge which takes the ball to the left of thirdman
Full length ball on off, driven back to the bowler
Straighter this time, tucked to the on side but no run that time
Back of a length, steered to the covers for an easy single
Back of a length, rocks back and angles it to the on side for a quick single. That seems to be the tactic now
Slower ball this time. Nice change of pace by Bracken. Watts tries to tip and run but hits it straight to the fielder
Back of a length and outside off, square driven to cover
Banged in short from Tait. Screaming delivery that but the line was all wrong. Batsman simply had to duck out of the way
Furious delivery again but drifting down leg. Full ball and Poonia gets a leg bye to fine leg
Tait getting his line all wrong here. Down the leg side again and Gilchrist collects it well diving to his left
Finally on off stump. Tapped away for a single to cover

Ripper! Full ball this time and swinging in from outside off. Poonia tries to get his bat down in time but can only end up playing all over it. Ball beats him for pace and clatters into the middle and leg stumps. Too fast and too furious.
Another yorker-length delivery but not on line this time. New batsman has no clue
Full and straight again but batsman flicks it to the leg side for a brace
Driven to mid-off. Full length from Bracken while bowling over the wicket
Good use of the angle again. Over the wicket from Bracken and batsman beaten while going for the cover drive. Airy shot that
Defended to the off side. Cautiously played
Full and outside off, Watson simply shoulders arms and lets it go
Similar delivery, slightly wide of off and Watson simply shoulders arms yet again
Straight and back of a length, defended solidly back to the bowler
on top of the offstump, nudged down to third man
again on the offstump line, tapped close on the off side and they rush across for a quick single
Played on! McGrath gets yet another ODI victim. Lands on a length, just outside off, comes in a touch and Watts plays with soft hands. Too soft and it rolls back to the off stump.
welcomes the new batsman with a bouncer. On the leg and middle stump line, ducked under
130 kmph delivery, gets bounce from the good length and it angles away, left alone
126.3 kmph, in the zone outside off, left alone
Watson starts off with a delivery on the off stump line, pushed to point
slightly fuller, on the off and middle, comes in a touch, worked to the on side
beaten! Full, in the teasing channel outside off stump, and goes on straight. Watson ends up pushing inside the line but atleast he didn't hang his bat out.
Perfume ball! Screams in at the throat of Watson who sways away
beaten all hands up. Landed on a length, around off stump and then straightened a touch. Watson, again, plays inside the line.
slides on to the pads and is rapped on the front pad. Going down though.
on the legs, clipped off the pads to Hogg at fine leg
honing in on the middle stump line, full in length, he has a stab at it and gets a inside edge, down to long leg
full and straight, a forward prod, clips the inside edge and on to the pad
Hamilton gets behind that one and offers the full face of the bat in defense
attempted yorker, on the middle stump line, dug out to cover
short of length, on the leg and middle, helped past square-leg
on a length, around off and middle, tapped close to the off stump and they rush across for a quick single. Ponting swoops in from cover but doesn't manage to pick the ball.
from wide of the crease, full in length, on the off stump, pushed to cover point
133.5kmph bouncer and easily ducked under
just short of length, on the off stump, pushed to point
And again.
Surprise bouncer. Not a surprising result. Right at the throat and Watson is unable to get away from it. Ends up fending a dolly to Bracken at short fine leg

serves a yorker! dug out past the bowler and Brown sets off for a run. Hamiton doesn't bother to move. He stays rooted. Could have got ugly but Brown gets back in time before the throw from mid-on comes.
Punched away! Short of length, just outside off and Brown moved into the line and hit it on the up through the cover region. Super shot that.
angling away, punched to cover
hits the deck short of length, around middle and off, Hamilton goes back, whips it across the line towards midwicket
slightly overpitched, on the off stump line, driven to cover
Short of length, sliding away outside off, Hamilton rocks back to punch it to cover
back-of-length, on the off stump line and Hamilton whips it to the on side
bouncer and Brown has no problem in getting under that.
rushes towards the off stump, Hamilton eases it towards covers, wants a run and this time its Dougie's turn to send him back.
130.04 kmph and whistling through the channel outside off. Bit of bounce as well and Hamilton has a poke at it and is beaten
Wicket no 48, in the World Cup games,  for Pigeon! Typical Mcgrath delivery. A teaser on the off stump line and Hamilton is sucked into a fatal prod.
128.8 kmph yorker on the middle stump, jabbed back down the track
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
fullish, outside off, square-driven to point
Caressed away. Overpitched outside off and Dougie Brown leant into his cover drive
drags back the length, on the off stump line, pushed to point
fuller and on the off and middle, driven to cover
on the off stump line, full and straight, pushed to cover region
angling in from outside off, jabbed away to the off side
122.6 kmph bouncer and ducked under
lands on a length, outside off, comes in a touch, dabbed past backward point
another length-delivery, on the off and middle, defended on the front foot
And again.
Deja-vu.
full and outside off, driven to cover
Creamed away! Overpitched outside off, you can have pace but you got to hit the right areas, else you will be bleeding. Driven through cover
142.k bouncer comes as a response. No problem in letting that one fly past him
Another one drilled through the off side. Tait is bowling half-volleys here and is paying for them.
Wow! Dougie Brown lets rip. Shot of the day. Length-delivery, just outside off and Brown thrusts his left foot out and square-drives past point. Screaming shot.
overpitched outside off, driven to cover
lands on a length, just outside off, comes in a tad, defended away
on top of the offstump, again that disconcerting bounce, Dougie Brown gets behind that one, pushes it out to off side
honing in on the off stump, eased into cover
lands outside off, straightens a touch, nudged to point
The usual McGrath line. Defended away to the cover region
turns in from outside off, not much, run down to short third man
tossed up a touch, outside off, again run down to short third man
flighted outside off, drilled right back at the bowler
googly arrives. Lands on a length around off stump, Smith picks it off the turf and lets it go through to Gilchrist
floated on off and middle, driven to long on
lands outside off, turns in, Smith pushes at it, the ball bounds off the pad, through the vacant slip region for couple of runs
overpitched on the off stump, smashed to cover
just short of length, just outside off stump, nudged to backward point
just short of driveable length, on the off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
honing in on the off stump line, nudged to backward point
bouncer. Again sails harmlessly over the batsman
back-of-length delivery, on the off stump line, defended off the front foot
floated outside off, swept to deep midwicket
low full toss, on the middle stump line, driven to long on
lands outside off, full in length, pushed to left of cover where Clarke gets across but can't prevent a single
spins from outside off, rapped on the pad as he pushes forward in defense
short and pulled but straight to the man at deep midwicket
lands outside off, comes in a touch, pushed to point
slow legcutter that landed on the off stump line before curving away. Smith does well not to chase after it, ends up pushing down the line
Crack! Gives the charge, Watson responds by banging it in and Smith backs away to cut it over backward point.
short of length, on the off stump line, nudged to point
on the off and middle stump line, worked to the on side
strangling line, around off and middle, pushed back down the track
on the off and middle, slight turn in, dabbed to right of square-leg
lovely flight, dips in front of off stump line, pushed back down the track
googly, fraction short and swept past midwicket
turns in from outside off, padded away
pushes that wider, bit slower in the air, inviting a drive but resisted. Just nudged away to point
on the middle this time, turned to midwicket
full and straight on the off stump, punched to long on
full and outside off, run down to third man
leg cutter on the off stump line, punched to long off
bouncer and easily ducked under
on the middle and leg, from short of length, dabbed towards mid-on
straight delivery on the off stump, driven to right of mid-off
worked to right of Ponting at midwicket and they will get a single
leans forward to a delivery that lands outside off and pushes it towards point
Googly that lands outside leg stump, he shapes to sweep and is rapped on the pad
tossed up, on the middle, driven back to the bowler
edge but no slip in place. Tossed up outside off and Smith drives only to get an edge.
slightly short, turns in, cut to backward point
on the middle and leg, worked to midwicket
lands just outside off, slightly short and paddled away to fine leg
bit of flight, not much of a loop, and Smith comes down the track to drive it to long on
Joy for Hodge. Maiden ODI wicket. Tossed up and Dougie Brown couldn't resist a hit. Sends it down the throat of Watson at long on.
slow turn, from outside off stump, worked past square-leg
tossed up outside off, comes down the track but is unable to get to the pitch. Changes tack and defends.
lands outside off stump, turns in slightly and padded away. They go up in appeal but it didn't turn in enough
turn and bounce. lands outside off, comes in and goes through the bat and pad gap to Gilchrist.
googly, lands on off and middle, turns away, nudged to silly point
spins in from outside off, defended off the front foot
quicker, on the middle and off, turns in, worked to midwicket
short in length, turns down leg side, tickled to square-leg
lands on the middle stump line, turns towards leg stump, tickled to the leg side
comes down the track, takes it on the full, drives it to long off
on the middle and leg, turned to right of square-leg
down the track and a drive to long on
long-hop on the leg and middle, pulled in front of square. Easy.
googly, itching to come forward, arrests his movement on seeing the googly and pushes it out to point
another googly, attempted sweep, no contact.
leans forward to smother a full-length delivery
appeal for lbw as he pushes forward in defence. hit on the off stump line and the ball was turning in. Hmm...
low full toss, outside off, attempted sweep shot and is rapped on the pad
floated outside off, driven to left of Hodge who makes a good tumbling stop
shouts of catch it as he turns a length delivery in the air towards midwicket but it falls well short of Ponting
tossed up on the middle and leg, driven to long on
driven back to the bowler
floated on the off stump line, attempts to work it to on side and is rapped on the pad
Tait starts off with a full delivery down the leg side, Smith tries to paddle it but can only take it on the pads
Short and wide outside off. Steepling delivery and Smith's waft can only strike the air. Tait too fast for Scotland. Now if only he could get his direction more often
Back of a length and on off. Smith jabs to the off side and takes off for a single. 100 comes up for Scotland and the crowd is ecstatic
Speared down leg again. Thank heavens Tait isn't a fighter pilot. His sense of direction is so awry. Batsman simply has to kick it away to the fine leg fence. Looked more like byes though

Gone. That's much better. Full and straight and screaming quick. Wright shuffles across the crease and is a sitting duck in front of the wicket. Struck on the pads and Asoka de Silva has no hesitation in giving the decision. Plumb as it gets. Tait strikes
Full and straight again. 147.4 kph and swinging in. Rogers gets his bat down in time and keeps it away
Full ball, sweep not well timed
Driven to gully, straight to the fielder
Back of a length and straight, tapped to the leg side
defended back to the bowler
taps it to the off side and takes off for a quick single
Well tossed up outside off, batsmen in a quandry about whether to attack or defend and chooses the safer option in the last moment. Silly point waiting for the edge but it drops short
Full and straight. Batsman keeps it out again. When Tait gets it on the money, the batsmen can only jut their bat out and hope
Or. As Colin Smith prefers back away and clatter it past gully for a sizzling boundary
Attempted yorker, Smith keeps it out and gets it to gully
Full and on leg stump. 141.4 from Tait. The ball deflects off Smith's pads and they scamper a leg bye
And there we go again. Way, way down leg side. Past the batsman, past Gilchrist and almost past the diving Bracken at fine leg. But he stops the boundary
Full ball off stump, batsman keeps it out to the off side
Cover driven for a single
beaten. Short in length and outside off, shapes to cut but no contact
well outside off, reaches out for it and drives to right of cover where a tumbling half-stop is made
tossed up, full in length, charges out, misses the drive but drags back his feet in time before Gilchrist whipped off the bails
slightly short, on off and middle, rocks back to pull it to left of deep midwicket.
again slightly short, this time just outside off, Smith goes back to punch it to sweeper cover
tossed up, outside off, driven to cover
drifting on to the pads, runs down behind square-leg
where did that come from? Smith backs away and crashes a fullish delivery on the middle stump, past backward point!
on the middle stump, 142.2 kmph, stabs at it and gets a inside edge down to long leg
full and straight, just outside off, he attempts to drive it, another inside-edge and the ball rolls over towards short fine leg
on the off stump line, Rogers pushes it back to the bowler
pushes it outside off, Rogers gets across, taps it to cover  region for a single
short in length, outside off, keeps a touch low, and punched to cover
bit of drift away and lands well outside off, SMith reaches out for it, is beaten by the drift, jabs it away
closer to the off stump and pushed back down the track
slightly short, on the off and middle, punched back to Hodge
slow through the air, drifts away and lands outside off, turns in, prodded away
turns in quickly, from outside off, gets through the bat and pad gap and runs off the back thigh towards short thirdman region
googly, well picked up and dabbed to backward point region

fifty up for Smith. His colleagues in the pavilion stand up to applaud. Scottish fans in the arena clear their lungs. Maiden fifty. Only the second Scottish batsman to get a fifty in WC. On the legs and swept away to long leg
beaten flirting outside off and Gilchrist whips off the bails but the batsman had not left his castle.
sliding down the off stump line, nudged to point
full in length, outside off, pushed to left of cover and they will get a single
full in length, on the off and middle, drives and gets an outside edge to point
pushed to left of Ponting at cover who has a shy at non-striker's end.

A run out! offcutter on the off stump line, pushed towards Hayden who rushes in from point and  rolls it along the ground to Gilchrist - lost some time there but still fast enough to catch the batsman short.

Sharp turn there! Cleans up Smith. Lands outside off stump and spins back sharply. He shapes to cut but is surprised by the turn and its all over. Good outing for Smith. This is the 48th instance of a batsman registering 50+ score on World Cup debut. 
Since Blain is injured and  won't bat, Australia have sealed up a facile win.
